attributes.action: Parliamentary Party Leaders to be appointed by party Members of Parliament
attributes.additional_details: Prime Ministers must reflect the outcomes of the ballot box and not be subject to a process of selecting Party Leadership that can be abused and manipulated - the electorate choose their respective MPs to reflect the will of the people not minority paid up members of whatever party. The electorate must trust a system that will produce a Prime Minister truly representing the voting outcomes of the ballot box
attributes.background:
Parliamentary Party Leaderhip to be selected by MPs not the membership of a Political Party - this disadvantages non members who vote for a political party.
Excluding MPs from electing Party Leadership might lead to a Prime Minister representing less than 1% of those who voted at the ballot box.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because it is the responsibility of political parties to decide how to electe their leaders, not the UK Government or Parliament as a whole.
